holidays.name: National Serpent Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating snakes and dispelling myths and fears about these slithering creatures.
holidays.origin: Created by reptile enthusiasts to promote education, conservation, and appreciation of snakes around the world.
holidays.funFact: Despite their scary reputation, snakes play a huge role in keeping ecosystems balanced by controlling rodent populations.

holidays.name: Bubble Gum Day
holidays.description: A sweet celebration of everyone's favorite chewy, blowable candy: bubble gum!
holidays.origin: Started in the 1970s to honor the invention and popularity of bubble gum as a fun treat.
holidays.funFact: The world‚Äôs largest bubble blown measured over 20 inches in diameter, nearly as big as a basketball!

holidays.name: World Introvert Day
holidays.description: An observance to honor introverts everywhere and recognize the unique strengths and contributions of quieter personalities.
holidays.origin: Originated from social media campaigns encouraging people to appreciate the introverted mindset.
holidays.funFact: Introverts tend to have higher activity in areas of the brain associated with internal thoughts and reflection.

holidays.name: Brigid's Day (Imbolc)
holidays.description: An ancient Celtic festival marking the beginning of spring and honoring the goddess Brigid, symbolizing fertility, healing, and poetry.
holidays.origin: Rooted in pagan traditions, later integrated into Christian culture celebrating St. Brigid.
holidays.funFact: People often make Brigid crosses from rushes or straw as protective charms on this day.
